reviewText: These Gerber Baby Girls' Footed Pajamas are a good buy if you need extra jammies, but they come with a few quirks. They're comfortable and easy to zip, and the material isn't too warm, which works well for keeping my little one cozy but not overheated.However, the fit is a bit off—the legs are quite long, while the butt area is tight, especially if your baby wears cloth diapers. reviewText: These disposables are conveniently packed so they don't take up much space. The cotton/polyester blend socks looked tiny but they stretch to fit on a size 9, (though not my size 14 kid.) They're thin like dress socks but the stretchiness is supportive enough to feel comfortable while keeping them from sliding down. The underwear seemed a bit large compared to regular briefs of the same size. They looked somewhat less like women's underwear than similar products we've seen. They've even been able to be washed, dried in the dryer, and reworn a few times. These got used quickly because of a snowstorm keeping some family in town without clean clothes, so I'm glad I'd ordered these just enough ahead of time. I can definitely recommend keeping some of these in the glove box or trunk for emergencies.

reviewText: I live in Montana and bought this for late fall thru early spring working outside. I have also used this for hiking during those times. I put this jacket through -20F to 45F in rain, snow, wet snowy rain, wind and sunshine. Bottom line is I liked it more than I didn't and for $40 I'm happy. BTW I bought the Army green version.If you are thinking about buying this, I feel like this is important to know:1 - It's a softshell outer jacket - Not a winter coat.  It is parka style meaning it comes down below the buttox and has 2 zippers on the front.2 - It's not waterproof - It is water repellant and did a good job in wet snow keeping me dry on a daily basis. It dried out fairly quicky when hung by a fire.3 - It's a really weird coat!PROS:Looks awesome!Lots of zippered pockets (which is also a con)Sleeve length was perfect and the bottom didn't rise up above my waist when reaching overhead.Loved the construction of the hood with the reinforced bill and the adjustable straps for both the hood and bottom of the jacket.The armpit zippers is why I bought this in the first place!Very thin layer of fleece on the inside.Snowshoeing at -10F with a base layer and the arm pit zippers open, I was plenty warm! Which is what I was looking for in jacket.CONS:The fit was off for me. Not by a lot, just a really small portion that didn't warrant ordering a larger size because then it would be way to big. It was tight in the shoulders and arms were super tight.No way you are getting cell phone in any of those arm pockets.Zippers are not seam sealedNo stretch to the materialVelcro cuff tighteners - yeah.....I don't see that lasting in the rain for more than a couple years.Not for hunting - this is the noisiest jacket I own! It is loud when you move!If you wear a short sleeved shirt under the jacket you can feel the cold armpit zippers on your inner arm.WEIRD:The elbows or perhaps forearms have a reinforced outer layer. But it doesn't come to the elbows on me or completely cover my forearms (for when I am crawling I guess?)It has these 2 inner pockets? Or for some other purpose that I can't figure out because it is not sewn on the bottom (see pic) So it stores nothing.You have these random weird velcro patches on the bottom of the jacket and back of the hood that I have no idea what they are for.I am guessing the weird velcro pocket on the inside of the hood is for you to roll up the hood, but why would you?Zippered back pockets - I can't even reach them! Not even sure what the purpose of them being there is other than to transport gear which I wouldn't do because the coat is not fully waterproof. Might be good for storing some cans of beer though on a hike.Inner cinching strings for the hood run along the inner coat into the kangaroo pockets. Easy to get this caught or torn (see pics)The jacket is weird, but it has worked well so all is good.

reviewText: Well i bought this so i can have an affordable puffer jacket i can abuse and not feel bad about. used it for everything and anything that involved being cold outside.Not wanting to risk expensive jacket incase i ruin it or hate it i purchased this one but so far it has withstood the abuse. i am pleased with the purchase and i recommend it if your in the market for this item  and price is an issue . i have used it for  concerts ,camping ,late night shopping trips ,taking out the trash at 4 am also just for the random day hikes .things i like it packs really small and is very light it also comes with its own drawstring bag that seams to match the color you purchased , i think anyhow because i have purchased 4 different colors (Christmas presents for family members ) and all come this way.Also this thing does very well in windy conditions it seams to have a very thin feel for a puffer jacket but the small amount of insulations paired with the inner and outer shell of jacket material reminds me of safety blankets ability to reflect body heat back to you this feature for staying warm is doing great for lack of poof.i took this to a  outdoor concert in LA (besame mucho) and it was very cold and windy because of concert rules only small see through bags were allowed so i brought this jacket in its drawstring bag and took a very small amount of space and was perfect for the situation kept me warm through the whole night night. had very large outside pockets with zipper closures and very deep inside pocket behind the outside zip up ones, they seam to share the space keep this in mind when placing bulky items one side will use space from the other even thought they are separate a pocket . the hoody does not have draw strings but i dont feel needs them i think we have gotten use to everything needing drawstrings, it is a bit spacious inside the hood i guess if you have a beanie or a baseball style cap it should fit fine and extends just before the bill of cap. i just hated that they tried to ship it in no box just a clear see through bag the first time had to return arrived damaged.In new condition its durability is uncertain until this point it has held up (2months), not sure yet the feel is not the toughest it has a thin feel but notably i have not torn it and it has at least been through the wash once keep in mind i airdried all this said it looks brand new and is in great shape , i would whole heartedly recommend this jacket just look for the deals also get the vest for an added layer of warmth

reviewText: I was done with messing with cheap jackets. Frogg Toggs are great.. but too light weight when I'm not backpacking, or I'm out with my rocket club flying high power rockets. I needed a heavier duty, every day jacket/windbreaker. Something with a quality hood and good solid pockets. I almost bought a Swiss Tech from the store, but then saw this one.. and thought I would risk it. SO glad I did.. I love the look, the feel, even the smell.  The pockets are all water proof/resistant.. the zippers are good quality, the hood with big, snappable face flaps is great! The hood even has a heavy duty zipper to make it modular... and the cinchable waist and wrist pulls means you can really stay cozy on windy days.  Everything about this jacket is heavy duty.. I mean, not as heavy as my 5lb wax-canvas coat, but really heavy duty for a wind breaker!  I love it.. this is my new every day jacket.. and it really looks and feels great! I got one for my son too. :)UPDATE: The only con is I wish it had armpit gussets and more air flow slits.  BC it is waterproof, it doesn't breath much, so if you have it on while moving/working, it can get a hit hot & stuffy

reviewText: I had a preferred brand on Amazon for men’s shirts that fit taller men while being athletic fit. However, they have been out of stock for months so I took a chance and bought these.The fit is great, and it looks great. Loose in the abdomen tight in chest and sleeves just as advertised. The material quality is definitely superior to shirts I previously purchased. The neck area fits better than most, the stitching is much better quality. The material isn’t so thin that it feels cheap, but not so thick that it makes you hot.The ONLY COMPLAINT is they are not the length I was hoping for. The photos made it seem like they would be. When I lift my arms over my head the shirt shows my stomach. It’s just my pet peave. I’m 6’2” and have broad shoulders, and I hate that MOST shirts never seem to be long enough. If you are a tall guy this MAY be an issue. I’m afraid that they will all become unwearable after I wash them once but I’m going to give them a shot. Cross my fingers.That being said, for the majority of men out there, these shirts are a great choice. 5 star other than the length. But that’s just me being critical.

reviewText: Wearing a light colored shirt out to dinner while on vacation is a bit risky. Is there a good chance I manage to not get wine or food or dessert on it? Yes. Is there a good chance I get one or possibly all three on it? Also yes. So it's important to look good without being too pricey and ideally with the ability to withstand how I am. This shirt hits all of those points.Now, this is not a fully linen shirt, it's a linen blend that has the appearance of linen. For me, this is perfect because it means most things will wash out if they don't set, it's got a little bit of flex to it, and it doesn't wrinkle quite as easily or severely as linen. The fit is an athletic cut, which is what I was looking for. I'm 5' 10 192 lbs, medium frame, but bigger in the shoulders, 33 waist and the Medium was perfect. If you're a larger frame, go larger because the arms were a bit tight.I have it in white and blue. They were purchased for vacation/beach wear, but I think they may join the spring/supper rotation next year. Definitely a great value for what you get. I've purchased other items in the past from this brand and I've yet to be disappointed. The linen pants that match these shirts are also highly recommended for all of the same reasons, if you need to complete the look.

reviewText: I work at a car dealership and am on my feet all day so I heard these shoes were comfortable and light. I’m pretty careful with my stuff, especially the more expensive things I own, and yet in less than a month there is already tearing in the side of the shoe exposing fabric underneath. I haven’t even subjected the shoes to anything but walking on pavement or concrete floors and they’re already falling apart. There’s also a residual squeaking when I walk, making every footstep audible. I try not to wear these shoes if I don’t have to. They fit decent, but that doesn’t really matter if I’m squeaking my way down the hallway in shoes that were expensive but look like they’re falling apart more every day.

reviewText: I was never really a polo shirt person and, after having the four jobs in a row over the last 16 years where the uniform or dress code basically required a polo shirt or a dress shirt ... I started to understand why polo shirts can be such a tricky thing.  The tricky thing for me is to find the balance between something having thick enough fabric to have its own defined shape so that it fits and looks right ... while not being so thick that it either impedes movements or smothers me.  Further, with a previous brand I initially liked, I discovered the perils of cotton-based materials and that manufacturers may use a vastly different material mixture for different colors ... where, over time, some colors might remain XL because they're only 70% cotton), some might shrink slightly to L, and others might be even smaller than a M because they're 100% cotton.  Just very frustrating when you start off with the exact same brand, product line, and size and then less than 1/3 continue to fit properly.  That's why, when I started looking around for replacements of those I consider unwearable, I was glad to come across this particular polo shirt by Under Armor.  The product quality is  obvious even before putting it on.  And, once it is on, you can tell that it's not just a case of the fabric being a good thickness but that key areas are structurally reinforced not only to make it stronger but to also establish that desired profile.  Being intended for sports, it's also very comfortable to move around in and the relaxed fit and XXL sizing  was the perfect fit.  Even before for me, there is an extremely wide variety of color options ... while all being made from the same material.  Thus, providing me the variety of color choices that I love while avoiding a repeat of that last headache of shirts all starting off the same size originally but then gradually changing completely.  The fact they're also wrinkle-free and can just be rolled up for easy travel is the icing on the cake.

reviewText: So I've worn these jeans several times. And I've worn them at times where I didn't necessarily feel like I was really feeling my best. Do you know what I'm talking about? I wore these jeans to work with a baggy black hoodie and didn't really do much with my hair and was sort of rushing from work to an after work situation and I was focused more on just trying to get what I needed to get done done and not really focused super too much on my appearance, and two people at separate times said, dang girl! You're looking healthy in those jeans! (I'm paraphrasing for the sake of my reviewer status, but I think you get the picture.)  They're very high waisted, and I actually think that if you needed belly support,  like either at the beginning of a pregnancy or just postpartum, these might be really nice.  This might be nice Thanksgiving jeans if you know what I mean. They're stretchy and they are very energizing on your legs, and you don't have to wear them too tight or too loose to feel like they're really doing some nice things for your silhouette. I also liked that they had deep pockets that I could actually shove phone-sized objects into, and so that was an exciting moment for me.  I also think these would be great cosplay or dance jeans because they'll move with you and they feel really nice on. I mean you could take a yoga class in these jeans. I hesitate to use the word jeans to describe them because although they're stitched and styled to look like a classic jean, the fabric is really more like a yoga stretch but with a cotton finish, not with a Satine finish. They have a nice cotton feel to them, which I also very much like (even though I'm guessing there's a combination of spandex and Lycra in there). I'm pretty sure that these jeans come in a variety of different shades and colors and I specifically got the black ones. And yes. You can rest assured. Although I cannot speak to the other colors, because I'm just going to guess that it varies from shade to shade, the black pair that I have were opaque. You don't have to worry about things showing through. They were not see-through.  Overall I'm very satisfied with these and I hope that they really last. I've washed them a couple of times and there's no pilling or disintegration of the fabric so that's also very cool. And also great for the money. So yeah. Even on the day when I didn't really feel like I was looking my best, these jeans really felt great on and got some positive feedback, so I'm going to say a solid thumbs up on these. I'm 5'7 and the length was really good on me. It didn't drag the ground but it also wasn't too short. I felt like it hit it a nice place on my shoe but I also think you could wear them with heels and they wouldn't feel too short. Overall a solid piece.

reviewText: I recently tried the Lee Extreme Motion jeans, and they’ve completely changed my expectations for comfort and flexibility in denim. These jeans are a game-changer for anyone who values both style and functionality.Fit and Comfort:The Extreme Motion technology truly lives up to its name. The jeans offer an incredible amount of stretch, making them feel almost like wearing leggings while still looking like classic denim. The fit is snug but not restrictive, with a mid-rise waist that sits comfortably without sliding down. Whether I’m running errands, sitting at my desk, or even doing light activities, these jeans move with me effortlessly. The articulated knees and gusseted crotch add to the flexibility, making them perfect for all-day wear.Material and Durability:The fabric is a blend of cotton and stretchy materials that feel soft yet durable. They have a nice weight to them, so they don’t feel flimsy or cheap. After several washes, the color has held up well, and there’s been no noticeable fading or loss of shape. The stitching and hardware (like the button and zipper) are solid and well-made, which gives me confidence in their longevity.Style and Design:These jeans have a modern, streamlined look that works for both casual and slightly dressier occasions. I opted for the dark wash, which is versatile and pairs easily with almost anything—t-shirts, sweaters, or even a blazer. The five-pocket design is classic, and the back pockets are flattering without being overly embellished. They’re a great balance of practicality and style.Value for Money:For the level of comfort, flexibility, and quality, these jeans are absolutely worth the price. They’re a step above regular denim in terms of functionality, and I can see them becoming a staple in my wardrobe for years to come.Final Thoughts:If you’re looking for jeans that combine the comfort of athletic wear with the style of traditional denim, the Lee Extreme Motion jeans are a must-try. They’re perfect for anyone with an active lifestyle or just someone who wants to feel comfortable without sacrificing style. I’m already planning to buy another pair in a different wash!Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

reviewText: I never cared much for Wranglers. I don't think I've even worn them since junior high maybe when it was the typical school clothes jeans that my mom always bought for me. When I got old enough to buy my own clothes, I went for more designer jeans. Now, as an adult in my 40s, my partner bought me a pair of these Flex Waist Relaxed Fit jeans, and I am hooked. reviewText: Used to wear 13MWZs exclusively when I owned a ranch. This is the first pair I have bought in the last 20 years or so. What I like is that there has been no change in the color, comfort, style, denim weight or fit and finish of these jeans. Quality of fabrication (Mexico) is good. What I don't like is the denim seems to be woven less tight than it used to be. Will the denim be as durable as in the past? 13MWZ jeans used to be super-tough and took any chore you could throw at them from livestock handling to fencing. We'll see if my perception about the weave is correct but for now 4-stars.  Update 08Mar24: I went online to check if the weave of this product has changed. I read that Wrangler updated the weave of the rigid cotton fabric to allow movement of the fabric strands during flexing and washing. Allegedly, the service life of the 20x and 13MWG may be extended by up to 2-years. As per other reviews, yes the old rigid fabric has been replaced . Whoa is me, I prefer the true rigid fabric. The jeans lasted long enough and did not sag and bag during wearing like the new version. I detest comfort jeans with flex or synthetic add-ins to get products soft and stretchy out of the box...this is for pussy cats. I will maintain 4-stars as the jeans function as advertised. Please Wrangler, build the 13MWZ as before. If it ain't broke...don't fix it. Oh, for you guys whining about color fade, always wash your jeans inside out. The color will hold longer. Wash cold, hang to dry.  05Apr24. These jeans are so good for motorcycle riding I bought a second pair. After several washings, no shrinkage, no unraveling and no fit/shape change. From 4-stars to 5-stars. 14Aug24. Bought a pair of Shadow Black jeans to wear to forgo the blues for more lofty social activities. The black is as good as my previous 2 indigo purchases.  28Aug24. bought 4th pair! Adios Levis...5/5

reviewText: I like Carhartt t-shirts, as they are very well built. I always shop the sales as they tend to be pricey. I have also bought them as gifts for many people, and I always buy one size down from their normal shirt size and they have all fit them perfectly with a little room left over. One size down only is enough. These are not tapered fit or slim fit nancy boy shirts. These shirts are for men and are tailored as such.

reviewText: I purchased this shoe as well as a pair of the Skecher Afterburn M tennis shoes.  I wanted a dedicated work shoe, because I was going though my shoes pretty quickly from wearing the same pair all the time.  So, being that I had already had two previous pairs of the “Afterburn” shoe, and burned through each of them in just over a year respectively, I decided to get another pair of them and also get a pair of the Cessnock Food Service Shoe strictly for work.  Both pairs of shoes arrived yesterday, and today I wore the Food Service shoe (FSS) to work for the first time.I slipped them on and found them to be a perfect fit.  They are very light weight and comfortable.  Usually, I find new shoes need a few days of wear to break-in until they really conform to the shape of your foot and then begin to fit well, but that wasn’t the case with these FSS shoes; they fit perfectly the moment I put them on.I wore them all day at work and discovered something that really surprised me.  We had a snowstorm today and got about 2” by the time I got to work, and had a good 7” by the end of my shift.  I park outside so of course I have to brush the snow off the car.  After doing so I knocked the snow off my shoes before getting into the car.  I was surprised to see that the snow didn’t stick to the material on top of the shoes, it was as if there was a water repellant in/on the material.  I was sort of wondering why my feet weren’t getting cold while I was cleaning off my car and I guess that explains it.  Another surprise was the fact that these shoes make no sound when walking on a tile floor while having wet soles.  The “Afterburn” tennis shoes squeak like a rusty hinge when the bottom of the shoe is wet and you walk across tile or other such surfaces, but the FSS’s, are quiet as a mouse, not a sound comes from them, you could almost call them Ninja shoes.As for the style, well that’s a personal preference and these shoes suit me just fine.  I think they look sharp, and nobody even noticed I had a new pair of shoes on today.Durability is the unanswered question and being that I’ve only worn them one day, that question will remain unanswered for a while.  If I can get a solid two years out of them, just wearing them to work, I will definitely buy them again and certainly would recommend them to a friend.I hope this review helps with your decision.  Peace.

reviewText: Yeah, I've added a few pounds and went for a 12 to a ...gasp!...size 14. And no, I'm not going to tell you how much I weigh.  I don't want to even speak it out loud. Apparently I've shrunk a bit in my old age too.  I was 5' 7.5 but now am probably closer to 5'6.  I was pretty sure I need a size 14 but not sure about the length. I've always ordered regular. I measured my inseam (crotch seam to wherever you want it to hit) and thought their chart measurements were a little on the long side so, for the first time in my life, I ordered a short.  It's perfect!!  I can wear flats or heels with these.  The fabric is nice, (so sick of yoga pants materials) the price is great, I'll be ordering more pairs.  Good for work pants.

reviewText: This is a really good value for the included 8 pieces of disposable briefs and 6 pairs of disposable socks.The briefs come in 2 colors:  4 each of white and gray.The socks come in 2 colors:  3 each of black and gray.The quality is better than one would expect for garments described as disposable.  They are sturdy, well made, and comfortable.The briefs are as pictured online, and the fabric is relatively thick and is soft and comfortable.  They fit well and do not feel flimsy.The socks are a bit thin, but they are fine for walking around.  They come several inches up the ankles.These all come very well packaged.  There is a 4-pack of white underwear, a 4-pack of gray underwear, a 3-pack of black socks, and a 3-pack of gray socks.  I bring this up because these 4 separate compact packages make it very easy to toss into a suitcase, taking up very little room, so one can have disposable garments on a trip.I have used disposable underwear multiple times while traveling, and I find it really convenient to toss a used pair of underwear in the trash every day instead of having a bag of clothing to wash when I get home from my trip.All in all, this good quality collection of disposable underwear and socks represents quite a good value.

reviewText: As a woman who wants to venture into raw denim, and having read the reviews that caution against sizing, I ordered a size bigger than I would have needed, thinking that it would work better for my hips. I used the shrink to fit method - soaking them in hot water for an hour, pressing before dripping dry, then putting them on while damp to shape them. I did not expect the waist to stretch back out so much within one wear. By the time they were dry, I found that they sat under my waist, so I washed and donated them and have ordered one in my size.I like that the material is sturdy and well made - the first day after wearing them, I changed out of them to find slight chafing on the front of my thighs. It didn't bother me too much, though. Due to the thickness of the material, they withstand the wind and keep my legs warm. Though it seems that some wish the colour were darker, I like that they are a unique blue because it makes them look like the simple work jeans they are meant to be.I already love the 14MWZ I have and look forward to experimenting with the shrink to fit process on the ones I have ordered in my size.

reviewText: The Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 9 Running Shoes have quickly become my go-to pair for everything from running errands to hitting the pavement for a serious jog.First off, the comfort is unmatched. The Charged Cushioning midsole provides just the right amount of bounce and support, making every step feel light and effortless. Whether I'm pounding out a 5K or just on my feet all day, my feet feel great, with zero soreness or fatigue.The fit is spot on, too. The mesh upper is breathable, keeping my feet cool even during intense runs, and the overlays provide excellent support without feeling restrictive. The shoes feel snug where they should but never tight or uncomfortable.The durable rubber outsole has fantastic traction, so I feel confident running on wet sidewalks, gravel paths, or even uneven terrain. These shoes truly feel built for versatility and performance.On top of all that, they look great! The sleek design and variety of color options make them perfect for both workouts and casual wear.Overall, the Under Armour Charged Assert 9 Running Shoes deliver on every level—comfort, performance, durability, and style. They’re an incredible value, and I can’t recommend them enough to runners and anyone looking for a reliable, comfortable pair of sneakers!

reviewText: These are commonly referred to as a dupe of the much more expensive Lululemon shorts. I needed athletic shorts and ordered both at the same time with a 5-inch inseam and linerless to see how close they actually are. I like a good deal, but I am also quite picky about quality and longevity. I read many reviews before buying, and here is the review I wish I had read.So...Are these just as good as the expensive shorts for less than half the price?-Fit:The term dupe means the same exact cut as the original. So, are they a true dupe? They are close.I ordered the 5-inch inseam in the CRZ shorts, and it feels more like a 6-inch inseam, so I tend to roll the band, which makes them feel more like a 5-inch inseam. You can see this difference in the pictures I've provided. Overall, they fit true to size. I ordered a L in both brands, and they fit about the same, maybe with slightly more leg room in the CRZ shorts.-Feel:Many say they feel exactly like the LL shorts. I'm fairly picky and disagree.It's closer in fit than it is in feel. They are not as soft, though they still feel quite nice in their own way. This could be due to the LL shorts' material being brushed in production or the material composition. The LL pace breaker shorts use rayon, which is a more premium fabric than the spandex used in the CRZ shorts. CRZ's material is thinner than the LL pace breaker, which makes them feel flowy in comparison. I like how lightweight the CRZ shorts feel. It barely feels like you have anything on.-Finish:You mostly get what you pay for here, with a little caveat...The pockets on the CRZ shorts are much better at accommodating my larger iPhone 11 Pro Max. Very deep pockets. The zipper on the CRZ shorts does feel a bit thinner and not as high quality as the LL. The pace breaker zipper feels sturdier and glides open with ease. The zipper on the CRZ is not as smooth. Hardware like zippers, grommets, buttons, etc., are where some costs were cut.I was hesitant to order these with people complaining about the drawstring fraying from the metal end coming loose after washing. I followed the wash instructions using cold water and air drying. I did not have this problem. I'm inclined to believe it's user error, assuming the metal end was more likely to come loose with heat and friction. The LL shorts use a plastic branded drawstring end, and the CRZ shorts use metal. The metal feels more premium by far.The CRZ shorts have a silicone label at the hem, and the LL have a stiffer plastic label. Silicone labels tend to not hold up as well if they are heat pressed. The CRZ branding seems to hold up well after washes.The color of the CRZ shorts is fairly accurate to the images shown online. I ordered a pair of the Green Sage and Gull Grey.-Final Verdict:Will I be buying more CRZ shorts or more Lululemon? I will be buying more CRZ.With the CRZ shorts, you get a little more than you pay for, and with the Lululemon, I think you are paying more than what you actually get. Comparing these two isn't fair, and I think the CRZ are good in their own way. I will be buying more of whatever lasts longer ultimately and will update this review if anything changes.-TL;DR: Buy the CRZ because they are good in their own way and not because they are a dupe.

reviewText: I have several dresses by this brand Pretty Garden and I love all of them.  They wash well in cold water and hang to dry. reviewText: I bought this coat to keep me warm while snow-blowing. I needed something warm but didn't want to spend much money since I wouldn't use it that often. However, I really like this coat and will wear it for more than just clearing snow. I wore it out the other morning in 10-degree F weather, which was pretty warm. The neck felt slightly cold, but I also removed the hood. I ordered a large one, and it fits well. I'm 5 9 and 180 pounds.**Pros:**- Well built-  Pretty Stylish- The fur on the inside and soft and comfortable- It has zippered pockets on the side and one on the front chest- Velcro closures for around the wrists and neck area- Velcro sections along the front zipper to help hold it closed.- Surprisingly warm for its weight.- Removable hood with zipper for attachment.**Cons:**- I wish the inside of the arms had the same fur as the rest of the coat.- The front zipper feels a little small to me. So far, so good, but this is a potential failure point.I would buy this coat again. I'm more happy with it than I thought I'd be. reviewText: I have a strong desire to weed out plastic in the areas of our lives that it doesnt belong in and clothing is one of them! The covered waistband is a game-changer, ditching the elastic torture for soft fabric that won’t dig into your skin.The multipack is a win for anyone who’s ever panicked on laundry day, and the durability means they’ll survive countless washes without losing their shape. Sure, they’re not flashy (no neon prints here), and they might feel a tad tight at first, but once you break them in, they’re pure comfort. Just don’t expect them to be gym-ready—these are for lounging, not sweating.

reviewText: This review covers the COOFANDY Men's Textured Polo Shirt, a short-sleeve, slim-fit, casual button polo designed for summer wear, and suitable for activities like golf.Fit and Comfort: This shirt is a winner in terms of fit and comfort. As a 6'0, 240lb man with a dad bod, I appreciate the soft and stretchy material. I purchased a 2XL, my usual size, and found it to be true to size. The shirt looks great and is comfortable enough to wear all day. The ribbed texture adds a nice touch and enhances the overall feel.Material and Quality: The material is fantastic – soft against the skin and ribbed throughout. It feels high-quality, and the design, sleeve length, and neck opening are all well-executed. The quality of this shirt is spot-on and on par with, or even exceeding, its value.Style and Versatility: This polo is incredibly versatile. It can be dressed up or down, making it suitable for various occasions. I can easily wear it with jeans, khakis, or even slacks and a jacket. It's appropriate for work, casual outings, and most other events.Color: I purchased the denim blue color, and it looks even better in person than it does online. I rarely say that about garments unless I've seen them in person first.Overall Impression: This COOFANDY polo shirt is a fantastic find. The combination of comfort, quality, style, and versatility makes it a great value. I'm very pleased with my purchase and hope it lasts a long time.Recommendation: I highly recommend this shirt. If you're looking for a comfortable, stylish, and versatile polo that offers excellent quality for the price, this is a great option. Take a chance on it; you'll likely be as pleasantly surprised as I was.

reviewText: **UPDATE: I returned the L/Tall via UPS drop off, cost me $8 for them to box it up (lesson learned). I now have an XL/Tall and thankfully have slightly more room for my wrists in the cuff area, still very tight in the bottom part of sleeves but at least it will fit over my gloves! This would be my favorite jacket if the cuffs were not so tight/ if Carhartt used the same larger zipper from the older jackets (small zipper will be a pain to zip in the cold for sure, as other reviewers have rightly mentioned)/ Also the hand pockets are small... so I changed my rating from 3 stars to 4. If Carhartt fixed these 3 issues, then this would easily be my favorite jacket!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I'm 6'3 and 230 lbs.,was in great shape back in the day (Lifted weights/ Army lean an' mean), but now I look like a weasel that's preggers... So anyways, this new Large/ Tall sized jacket fits tighter in the chest area than my old Carhartt Large/ Regular (old Carhartt was a cheaper hooded style/ basic model). The sleeves are tighter compared to the old style (maybe because of Sherpa lining?), but the BIG reason I am leaving this review and returning this product for an XL/ Tall is because the sleeve cuffs are SOOO tight!! Even the outer sleeve around the stretchy cuff is crazy tight, so no way to pull my sweatshirt sleeves through the jacket cuffs and absolutely no way for me to tuck my long wool gloves inside the cuffs.This particular jacket was made in Indonesia. I know that the same model of clothing made in different countries will vary slightly (goes for all brands), but I am not sure if it is a quality control issue or if this new upgraded jacket is sized differently compared to the old base Carhartt model.Another con is that the zipper is smaller, as others have mentioned.Pros: this jacket feels warmer than my old basic model, arm movement will be better (in larger size, lol). I LOVE the Sherpa lining! Also, despite having a smaller zipper, I absolutely love the snap-over buttons! It is absolutely worth paying more for the upgraded buttons and lining!I hate to leave less than stellar review, but I will update it after I exchange this jacket for a larger one... If it is a quick worry-free exchange, then I will up the stars. If not, well... ITS COLD AND I NEED A JACKET NOW!!

reviewText: This is my first amazon review ever, and I buy almost everything on amazon. I have tried so many other brands of shirts like this on amazon and these are by far the best quality, have the best colors, and have the most attractive and natural fit. I wear them every day. Very breathable. The brushed, mottled colors are the best in my opinion. Wash cold, as after 2 years of constant washing on hot they shrink maybe 8% and loose about 3% of the color. That seems bad but I thrash these as an outdoor enthusiast and they have never ripped or disappointed. I have my cousin now on them too. I will have these as my go-to for the rest of my life. I just bought more and I’m so happy. The price is unbeatable.  I happily bought them to my needs regardless if there was a Black Friday / prime day even steeper sale.They pair so well with these shorts (mottled colors and matching material) BALLENZ, although the shorts are slightly long for running if you are short, so I roll them once from the top if I am running for the perfect size. If I am rock climbing, I leave them down so the harness does not ride up. I may find a better pair of shorts that has zipper pockets, as occasionally in the car I’ll have my keys fall out, but these shirts are 100% worth my money. They rival and beat many Nikes and Under Armour that I’ve had. Enjoy.

reviewText: For reference I am a women 5’3 and 135 lbs and ordered a small. I have slim legs and these pants fit me like a straight cut. They aren’t overly baggy but might be tight for a guy with thicker thighs.These pants are very breathable. I bought them to wear in my warehouse job which gets very hot. The length is long but cuffing them doesn’t look bad. I had to cuff them twice.I saw people complaining about how long the crotch is but that’s because these are not low rise pants. If you want low rise pants that are below the waist these aren’t for you. The crotch will hang too low if you wear them below the waist. I love high rise pants and it’s all I wear because it keeps my shirt tucked in and puts no pressure on my lower stomach. reviewText: The Hanes Men's Ecosmart Fleece Sweatshirt has become a cherished addition to my casual wardrobe, providing a perfect blend of comfort, warmth, and eco-conscious design. This sweatshirt from Hanes has not only met but exceeded my expectations, offering a cozy and sustainable option for everyday wear.The standout feature of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt is its commitment to sustainability. Crafted from a blend of cotton and recycled polyester fibers, this sweatshirt exemplifies Hanes' dedication to reducing environmental impact. The use of recycled materials not only contributes to a softer feel but also aligns with the growing demand for eco-friendly fashion choices.Comfort is paramount when it comes to a fleece sweatshirt, and the Hanes Ecosmart delivers in spades. The cotton-polyester blend creates a plush and soft texture against the skin, ensuring a cozy and comfortable fit. The fleece lining adds an extra layer of warmth, making it an ideal choice for cooler weather or casual lounging.The fit of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt strikes a balance between relaxed and tailored. It provides enough room for easy movement without appearing overly baggy. The ribbed cuffs and hem contribute to the overall structure, ensuring that the sweatshirt retains its shape even after multiple wears and washes.Durability is a key strength of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt. The double-needle stitching on the neckline, cuffs, and hemline adds reinforcement, enhancing the sweatshirt's longevity. I've found that it holds up well to regular washing, maintaining its color vibrancy and shape over time.Versatility is another notable feature of this sweatshirt. Whether paired with jeans for a casual outing or thrown over workout gear for added warmth, the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt seamlessly transitions between various occasions. The availability of a wide range of colors ensures that there's a shade to suit every style preference.The affordability of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt makes it an attractive choice for those seeking quality comfort without breaking the bank. The accessible price point, coupled with the sweatshirt's durability and sustainability features, positions it as a practical and budget-friendly option for a broad range of consumers.The purchase experience was hassle-free, with the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt readily available in many retail outlets and online platforms. The consistent sizing and clear care instructions add to the overall positive experience, making it easy to incorporate this sweatshirt into my regular rotation.In conclusion, the Hanes Men's Ecosmart Fleece Sweatshirt has earned its place as a reliable and sustainable go-to in my wardrobe. Its comfort, durability, and commitment to eco-friendly practices make it a standout choice for those seeking both coziness and conscientious design. Whether you prioritize comfort, sustainability, or a combination of both, the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt offers a winning formula for a timeless and versatile wardrobe essential.

reviewText: I've been through 4 pairs now. I have a treadmill desk and log all miles carefully, so I can say confidently I put on 400-450 miles of treadmill use on each pair, plus they are my daily driver so probably closer to 650 miles per year.I echo all the positive remarks about slip resistance, easy to put on, cushioned without feeling like I'm on a balloon, and subdued but professional appearance.On durability, I'm a little disappointed that they only last a year, but this was the first shoe I've tried on my treadmill desk, so I'm not sure how it compares to other shoes.In any case, every shoe has eventually failed in the same way, after a year of constant use: the plastic shaper in the heel falls apart and starts poking at my heel, and the cover of the foam insert disintegrates in a way that starts to wear my socks out quickly. It took me three pairs to realize that's why my expensive socks weren't lasting as long as they should.All said, I'll buy them again. They fit really well and look nice and are very comfortable to walk hundreds of miles in. I'll just need to remember to buy new ones every year!

reviewText: Size fits perfectly. My typical pants range is 34 by 30, I decided to go with a 33 by 30 instead. So a size smaller than my typical size. Largely because I hated having to wear a belt all the time on the 34's of other jean brands. These pants have a fair amount of stretch, so even if you order one below your normal waist size they should fit fine. I'm 5'11 and 200 lbs, they're slightly long, but I prefer to have the pants be a little bit longer than too short because it blends them in nice with my shoes. No issues sitting down or getting up. No indication that they'd rip or anything. The size lower is tight, but a comfortable tight.I washed them out of the packet on cold and a 60 minute drying timer, of which they did not shrink, deform or lose color. They didn't appear to be returns or anything.They fit better than expected, tighter around the buttock area but that's what I get for ordering under my normal size. Pockets are nice, able to hold my S24 Ultra with a case on it (not a small phone) so it'll hold most anything from a phone to a wallet. The pants do have standard rear pockets that appear to be able to hold a standard wallet. Rear pockets are about wallet height, forward pockets can fit my entire hand up to my wrist just fine. They're not too wide though, probably just enough to fit a phone and wallet ontop of each other and that's it.They feel sturdy enough to withstand most types of work.The only thing I don't like about the pants is the zipper. It's too long, like twice as long as the normal zipper you'd find on a pair of Wranglers or something. Nothing that'll dissuade most buyers, but I find zipping them all the way up to be kind of a pain. Could be that I ordered a size lower for sure, so it might just be me.10/10 will definitely buy again.

reviewText: These Under Armour Assert 10s work well as casual work shoes, though they weren't quite up to the task when I started using them for actual running. The Charged Cushioning is comfortable for all-day standing and walking on hard floors, and the breathable mesh upper keeps your feet from overheating during long shifts.For work, the neutral support and lightweight design make them a solid choice. The durability is decent for everyday walking, and they clean up easily when they get dirty. The grip is good on most indoor surfaces, even when dealing with the occasional spill.However, when I started using them for running, their limitations became clear. The cushioning compresses pretty quickly under the impact of regular running, and the support isn't substantial enough for longer distances. After about 50 miles of running, they started to show noticeable wear in the midsole, and the responsiveness diminished significantly.Bottom line: great comfortable shoe for work or casual wear, but serious runners should look elsewhere for their training shoes. Think of these more as athletic-styled work shoes rather than dedicated running shoes.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

reviewText: The Skechers Non-Slip Nampa Groton shoes are an absolute game-changer for anyone working in demanding environments like a jail. From the moment I slipped them on, I could feel the difference. The fit is impeccable, molding comfortably to my feet without any uncomfortable pressure points.Comfort is crucial when you're on your feet for extended periods, and these shoes deliver in spades. The cushioning provides excellent support, even after 10-hour shifts, ensuring my feet feel fresh throughout the day.But what truly sets these shoes apart is their slip-proof design. In a high-stress environment like a jail, where safety is paramount, having reliable footwear is non-negotiable. I've never experienced even a hint of slippage, giving me the confidence to move swiftly and securely, no matter the surface.Overall, the Skechers Non-Slip Nampa Groton shoes are a must-have for anyone working in similar environments. reviewText: I have a few of the high end 3-digit number shirts (not allowed to say their name) shirts and they are nice, but I am really enjoying the Zity shirts.  As a bigger guy 6ft 285lbs I am self-conscious about my man breasts and nipples showing through the shirt.  Ha!  Bet you never thought a guy would say that.  But the struggle is real.  These shirts fit perfectly for me.  They are not skintight in the chest, so I have no nipple showing and actually makes my MOOBS look smaller.  I wear 2xl in most shirts and the 2xl by zity fits perfect and true to size.  The shoulder pocket is a nice feature when I am working in the field, it's an easy place to put your pen and retrieve it as needed.  When I start sweating, I don't get those dark spots you get on other polos and the shirt cools off and dries quickly.  I wasn't sure how I felt about the orange star on the right sleeve, so far, its ok.  I catch the orange star out of the corner of my eye causing me to redirect my attention to my sleeve till I realize what it is.  No, I didn't receive a discount or free product for my review.  I just try to give the facts and help other big guys out.

reviewText: I recently had abdominal surgery related to cancer and was looking for a more flexible, comfortable pair of pants in a size bigger than I usually wear. I'm generally happy with Amazon-branded items and have bought other clothing items from the Amazon brand.I actually bought four pairs of these pants. They're a men's classic-fit, wrinkle-resistant pleated Chino that I bought in a Big & Tall size.These are definitely classic fit. They weren't quite as flexible as I'd hoped, though they fit well and I've been happy with them. I'm able to wear them in my work setting and they look professional.They are wrinkle resistant, though I would say they fade just a bit easier than I'd hoped. That said, I'm a wheelchair user who is tough on clothing and these are holding up well. I would also say they are very true to sizing.Overall, I'm quite happy with these. There's no doubt I'll buy Amazon-branded clothing again, though I may go a size higher to get the needed flexibility. However, these are a good combination of solid quality and affordability and I definitely give them a thumbs up.

reviewText: I recently purchased the Levi's Men's 569 Loose Straight Fit Jeans for my husband, and they have quickly become his go-to pair of jeans. These jeans offer a perfect combination of comfort, style, and durability, making them ideal for everyday wear.First and foremost, the fit of the Levi's 569 jeans is excellent. The loose straight fit provides plenty of room through the seat and thigh, ensuring maximum comfort without being overly baggy. The jeans sit at the waist and offer a relaxed fit that my husband finds perfect for all-day wear. The straight leg opening is versatile and looks great with a variety of footwear, from sneakers to boots.The quality of the denim is impressive. Made from 100% cotton, the jeans are both durable and comfortable. The fabric is thick enough to withstand regular wear and tear while still being soft and flexible. This balance between durability and comfort ensures that the jeans hold up well over time and continue to look and feel great.The style of the Levi's 569 jeans is timeless and versatile. They have a classic five-pocket design with the signature Levi's stitching on the back pockets. The range of available washes allows for easy pairing with different outfits, whether for a casual day out or a more polished look. My husband particularly appreciates the darker wash for its ability to transition seamlessly from day to night.One of the standout features of these jeans is their practicality. The loose fit and straight leg make them suitable for a wide range of activities, from running errands to outdoor adventures. My husband finds them comfortable enough for all-day wear, whether he's working, relaxing, or engaging in more active pursuits.In terms of maintenance, the Levi's 569 jeans are easy to care for. They can be machine washed and dried without losing their shape or color. The high-quality construction ensures that they maintain their fit and appearance even after multiple washes.Another advantage of these jeans is their inclusive sizing. Levi's offers a wide range of sizes, ensuring that men of all shapes and sizes can find a comfortable and flattering fit. This inclusivity is particularly important for finding the perfect pair of jeans that not only look good but also feel great to wear.In summary, the Levi's Men's 569 Loose Straight Fit Jeans are an excellent choice for anyone looking for comfortable, stylish, and durable jeans. Their superior fit, high-quality denim, and timeless design make them a standout option for everyday wear. I highly recommend these jeans to anyone seeking a reliable and versatile addition to their wardrobe. My husband loves them, and they have quickly become a staple in his collection.

reviewText: I bought a few similar jackets from different manufacturers and the plan was to keep the one that fit the best. This one came in second place, and I had to return it because another one fit me a little better. I ordered the small, and I am 5'6 tall and 150 lbs with short limbs and a wide frame. Nothing fits me well, so I usually have to settle for something that is close but not perfect. This jacket fit perfectly, but the sleeves and overall length were just a little bit longer than a competitor. I honestly would have kept this jacket if I had not tried the competitor's, because the extra length was negligible and comfortable. Generally speaking, this jacket style runs a little long in the sleeves for people like me with short arms. Then, if you buy a size extra-small (usually not available), it's too tight or too short in the overall length. This is a nice, well-constructed, lightweight jacket that feels warm. It's much lighter than a parka but it seems like it will work for cold and wet weather around 40-45 F. The hood also fits well without a hat and it seems like a very functional go-to jacket for cold rainy weather. The wrist elastic could be a little tighter in my opinion, but it's basically snug around the wrist. You can probably put a few stitches in the material and make it tighter with some clever sewing.

reviewText: I'm so sick of buying clothes online and having them not fit right. These shorts have redeemed my faith in online purchasing. I'm 5'-11, 185lbs, approx 33 waist. Bought a large and they looked huge when I pulled them out of the package, but when I put them on they fit like a glove. The elastic waist and stretchy fabric feels so nice. Seriously, when I squat down it's as if I'm wearing sweats. Since they have stretch, a large would also fit a larger waist, maybe even a smaller waist. But they look sturdy and as a professional landscape designer, I spend lots of time outside and need shorts in the summer that are cozy but also functional and somewhat professional (Seattle professional, that is). These fit that bill. Of course, when I say professional, I still like an urban and youthful flair. I'm 42 years old, and growing up in the 90s we don't be wearing short shorts, or shorts above the knee. These sit right below my kneecaps. They have a loose look and feel without looking overly baggy or ghetto. I like these a ton. I had a bad morning and weirdly, feeling these shorts on me, with their deep pockets that are great for wallets, phone, keys, etc., it truly brightened my day.

reviewText: So, I'm a huge fan of the adidas lite racer series, you don't have to deal with laces and yet they stay firm on the foot. I wore various generations of them for years and have something to say. 3.0 are still the best in terms of design and fit in my opinion, but they are partially discontinued since the selection is extremely limited on amazon currently, so I had no choice but to find a replacement for them. 7.0's fit is decent, very soft and comfy. One aspect these excel in over previous generations is the outer sole. Lite racer series for a long time suffered from their main flaw, which was that the outer sole erodes very fast, 7.0's actually seem decent in this regard, looks like adidas finally addressed this issue. The single biggest issue with these shoes is quality control. I had to return a couple of them before I got an acceptable pair. There is a significant inconsistency in the way the insole is attached.

reviewText: I do a lot of walking and standing. I prefer a negative heel such as kelso earth shoes, but they stopped making them and those shoes don't have the heel cushion I prefer to protect impact heel pain.  The kelso earth negative heel is thier patent so I don't know of any other shoe makers that offer a negative heel.  These shoes have a slightly higher heel than the toe pad and have a lot of impact cushion for the heel. They have reasonable arch support.  Lots of room in the toe box. I like that they are real leather which will last a long time. They are as cute and fashionable as one can get while looking for this level of comfort and stability.  Most other shoes in this category have a higher heel, but those put more strain on the arch.  I think these are perfect for traveling and touring. They are not especially heavy or light but they do the job.

reviewText: I have purchased multiple Burt's bees pajamas in the past and have loved them for the kids. They definitely run tight so I typically order larger than the size I need. Because they are usually tight, they can be difficult to squeeze babies arms into. The fabric is soft and seems very comfortable for our kids. reviewText: I got tired of my normal athletic shoes going bad from the stress of daily use on the job, so I went looking under the search term durable work shoes.  (Looking via Duck and Swisscows and Qwant, mind you, not via Amazon's own search fields, which, inexplicably, continue to be left as almost 100% useless.)Inevitably, nothing that was classified as a.) a shoe and b.) durable was available without a steel toe, so I relented and bought these.  For the record:  The heaviest thing I'm likely to drop on my feet is a disk of Lanthanum/Telluride alloy (or maybe Silicon/Germanium,) that's roughly the size, shape and weight of a U.S. Nickel, so I'm not really in need of steel-toed shoes.  But if you want durable, apparently you have to get the Medieval Class toe box, so I just bought them.I don't know if it's just the steel toe or a combination of that and the heavier-duty rubber and upper material, but these shoes are seriously heavy.  Not a big problem if you like the added exercise, but it would be great if shoe manufacturers would offer a version of the exact same work shoe with all of the exact same materials, but without the mëtal hardware.  But I knew that going in so...These are excellent shoes despite the weight.  I have wide feet and they're available in EE width (if they hadn't been I simply would not have bought them, because you can't be cool if your feet are uptight, as the old Hush Puppies ad used to say.)  They're built like tanks but are perfectly comfortable nonetheless, and I'm on my feet roughly 80% of every nine-hour workday.I got my normal size and width, and even with a pair of podiatrist-prescribed orthotic inserts and Odor-Eater pads, they fit perfectly.  When I put them on in the morning the toe areas do feel tight, but the inserts settle within minutes and they're a perfect fit thereafter.  So be aware that if you do not use any kind of insert these might be a little roomy.  The laces are also heavy-duty and the eyelets for them allow you to tighten them without messing with the loop-by-loop finger-pull thing - but neither do they let loose too easily - all of which I like lots.Given the excellent price, durability and fit, I'm really happy that I picked these.  Time will tell how well they'll hold up, but I've been wearing them on the job for two months and they still look and feel brand-new. I'm on hands and knees and crawling into the guts of systems and lab equipment frequently, and though the inevitable dirt is there, I don't even see so much as a scuff on the outer surfaces, anywhere.  Good shoes, if seriously heavy in the weight class.

reviewText: ZESICA Women's Summer Casual Flutter Short Sleeve Crew Neck Smocked Elastic WaistThe ZESICA Women's Summer Casual Flutter Short Sleeve Crew Neck Smocked Elastic Waist is the perfect addition to your summer wardrobe, offering a stylish and comfortable option for both casual and semi-dressed-up occasions. With its versatile design, this top can be dressed up with skirts or down with jeans or shorts, making it ideal for various activities, from casual outings to vacations.Stylish and Flattering DesignOne of the most appealing features of this top is its elegant, yet laid-back design. The flutter short sleeves give it a light, airy feel perfect for the warmer months. The crew neck adds a timeless touch, while the smocked elastic waist cinches the body, creating a flattering silhouette for all body types. The relaxed fit of the top provides comfort without sacrificing style, making it an excellent choice for everyday wear.Comfortable and Breathable FabricMade from a soft, breathable fabric, this top ensures that you stay cool and comfortable even on the hottest days. Whether you’re out running errands, enjoying a picnic, or lounging with friends, the lightweight material keeps you at ease. It’s also soft against the skin, offering a luxurious feel that adds to the overall comfort of the garment.Versatile Styling OptionsThe smocked elastic waist creates a flattering shape, and the relaxed fit of the top gives you plenty of room to move comfortably throughout the day. The flutter sleeves add a touch of femininity and movement, making it easy to pair with your favorite jeans, shorts, skirts, or even leggings. Whether you prefer a more casual look with flip-flops or a dressier vibe with sandals or wedges, this top can easily be styled for any occasion.Perfect for Summer ActivitiesThis top is designed with summer in mind. It’s lightweight and breathable, making it ideal for hot weather. The flutter sleeves provide just enough coverage without feeling too heavy or restrictive, making it perfect for those hot, sunny days. Whether you’re spending the day at the beach, exploring the city, or attending a casual barbecue, this top will keep you feeling stylish and comfortable all day long.Easy Care and MaintenanceThe ZESICA Women's Summer Casual Flutter Short Sleeve Crew Neck Smocked Elastic Waist is easy to care for, which is an added bonus for those with busy schedules. It can be machine washed, and the fabric holds its shape and color well even after multiple washes. This makes it a durable and low-maintenance addition to your wardrobe that you’ll be able to enjoy season after season.ConclusionThe ZESICA Women's Summer Casual Flutter Short Sleeve Crew Neck Smocked Elastic Waist top is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a comfortable, stylish, and versatile addition to their summer wardrobe. Its flattering fit, breathable fabric, and easy-to-style design make it perfect for a variety of occasions. Whether you're dressing it up or down, this top will keep you looking chic and feeling comfortable all summer long.

reviewText: I was looking for something very inexpensive to get for my teenager's job interview endeavors. This was a great purchase. I bought two, one in large and one in medium because its so hard to know with buying clothes online if it will truly fit well. The medium fit him perfectly (with a tad bit of room to spare) so I bought a second pair in medium and returned the large. I love that if he were to gain ten pounds in the next two months (hopefully not but just saying) that these will still fit comfortably. Return process was easy. So far I recommend this seller and these pants, and I'll update later if we discover the quality wasn't as great our initial impression. The only downside to them was the material is the kind that dog and cat hair will stick to like a magnet but we use lint rollers so non issue. If you don't have pets no worries. If you do, don't let them get on ya before heading out. Put them on right before you leave and then you'll avoid hairy pants, lol. These are priced really well for the good features and fit. I did get them on sale and paid about $21 for them. If he really likes the comfortability of these and wants more, Id even pay the regular $29 price as long as they're durable for the job (indoor jobs only – they're not a thick material) But Im always looking for a deal so Im super happy getting these on sale.

reviewText: Awesome!!!  Here is how I buy clothes.1. I like low cost. a. Amazon is low cost.  And I don't have to drive 50 miles to the Outlet store.2. I buy the same clothes over and over.  Always the same sizes and colors for the basic items. a. I buy Champion long boxer briefs, preferably made in Vietnam. b. I buy sock from Johnston and Murphy. c. I buy t-Shirts (and most other items) from Brooks Brothers Outlet.Unfortunately, Johnston and Murphy's over the calf blue merino wool socks change over the year.  Double pipes at first, then single pipes close together, then triple pipes.  All I want is the same exact blue sock and same exact grey sock year after year so that I can avoid matching socks out of the clean clothes basket.  No, what should be the same exact sock is a big mix and match event every morning.  Same thing with Champion.  Why do I have to check to see what country they are made in before buying them.  Why can't I just trust that Champion underwear are the same the world over.3. I like high quality.  Here is how I define quality: a. Don't skimp on material. b. Long staple threads. c. Ergonomically cut.Every single sock manufacturer out there is skimping on material on socks.  Johnston and Murphy, Brooks Brothers, all shorter as the years go by.  They make them a quarter of an inch shorter.  It doesn't sound like a lot.  But I have to keep pulling up my new socks.  I never have to pull up my old socks.  How much money is being saved by cutting the socks a quarter inch shorter?Brooks Brothers t-shirts are still pretty good.  I have stuck with Brooks Brothers because every other t-shirt manufacturer that I've tried makes them an inch shorter, which means they come untucked.  Brooks Brothers t-shirts always stay tucked in.  And they don't pill after 10 washes.  I hate pilled t-shirts.  I hate them!Ergonomically cut: my mother bought me some gold toe socks.  I have big calves.  The elastic cut into my calves by the end of the day.  Five year old Johnston and Murphy socks are butter smooth.  The new ones are starting to cut with a sharp rigid thread around the top.  Brooks Brothers has a nice soft elastic at the top--if you buy the non-outlet variety--which go for $25 - $50 per pair.  That's a lot of money for socks when I like to keep 15 pair of blue and 15 pair of grey in the drawer after a full wash.  That would be like $750 - $1,500 for socks.  But the ergonomics on a sock make the difference between a beautiful day and a day that makes you feel like you've been sweating out in the sun.So, here is the scoop on the Amazon Essentials t-Shirts:1. Value: They are $16 for 6 shirt.  So, that's about $32 per year that I would spend on t-shirts.  That's Awesome!2. Consistency: Amazon gets it!  They actually advertises that they are not going to keep switching up.  You get the same thing every time.  I'm sure they will find a better way to make something and that a change will occur every now and then.  That's fine if they make an improvement.  But I'm betting it will not be changing the number of pipes running down my socks.  I'm sure other brands change the number of pipes because they found a factory in one country that makes they cheaper than in another country.  And they are not made to Johnston and Murphy's specs.  They are just  socks already being produced by another manufacturer at a lower cost than the last factory.3. Ergonomics: The t-shirts fit well.  From what I can tell so far, Amazon Essentials t-shirts use long staple cotton that will not pill.But all of this is really to communicate to Amazon.  Nice job with Amazon Essentials!  Would you *please* make some over-the-calf dress socks.  I will love you even more than I already do.  Please consider making long inseam boxer briefs that somehow keep the legs from riding up or don't start slipping down.  Also, I wear a lot of all cotton, non-iron dress shirts.  All cotton, non-iron, pleated, chino's would be awesome.  Long rise, gaberdine dress slacks would be great!  But, maybe I'm getting beyond the essentials with the slacks.  But please, the socks!  I hate every reasonable priced sock, that I've tried, that is made today.

reviewText: First off, I'm 6'5" (1.96 m), 200 lbs (91 kg) and have an athletic build. I ordered size Large Tall.The Fit: The fit is reasonably good. The shoulders fit very well, the chest has enough room. The body length is good and this is the first jacket I've had in a long time where the sleeves are sufficiently long. The sleeves also are large enough to be comfortable moving around. The mid-section doesn't fit as well. Like many tall sized clothes, the assumption seems to  be that if you're tall you must also be big. It would be nice if it came in an inch or two from the chest to just above the waist. This isn't as bad when wearing a sweatshirt or sweater, but when just wearing a t-shirt or dress shirt it is almost too big. I decided to keep it anyway because it's hard to find a tall jacket that is tall enough, and even though the mid-section is big, it doesn't look worse for it.Features: This is what you would expect from a softshell jacket. It is warm enough to work for temps just below freezing, maybe lower if you layer. It is not as wind resistant as I expected, but isn't bad. I haven't tried it in the rain yet. The pockets are large and insulated, so they will keep your hands warm.Overall it's a solid jacket. It is more comfortable than the LL Bean jacket it replaced, and $40 cheaper.

I am wearing some shape wear underneath to keep things a little more firm. I’m 5’5” and approximately 222. I purchased an XL and feel very comfortable in it.I have sensory issues, so I am sensitive to different textures and clothing fit. I think this will be good for a work day, although the zipper does take some effort. Using the restroom may take an extra minute.Nice professional look, especially with accessories. Good price. The neckline isn’t uncomfortable for me, but it isn’t tacked down.

reviewText: I have been wearing Calvin Klein for a long time and decided to try a bunch of new underwear.  This was the only cotton pair and I like them the second least.  They don't have the best fit and aren't as comfy as the others.  However, they were by far the cheapest, so for the price I will still give them 4 stars.  Quick comparisons to the other brands are below, ranked by my personal preference.1. Lululemon Always in Motion Boxer 5 Inch - 5 Stars: Easily the most comfortable, but pretty pricey.  The only pair that doesn't ride when moving around.2. Under Armour Men's Tech 6-inch Boxerjock 2-Pack - 4.5 Stars: Not quite as comfortable as Lululemon, but still pretty comfortable and more affordable.  Great at absorbing moisture but ride up your leg a bit sometimes.3. Calvin Klein - 4-5 Stars: I actually have a ton of these and don't remember the exact ones.  Some of them fit decently well, and some not so much. On average they are pretty decent though4. ExOfficio Men's Give-n-go Boxer Brief - 3.5 Stars: These are... fine.  They are middle of the road in comfort and good at absorbing moisture.  But for the price there are just way better options.5. Pair of Thieves Super Fit Underwear for Men Pack - 2 & 3 Pack Boxer Briefs - AMZ Exclusive - 3.5 Stars: These are weird.  Super comfy when dry, but terrible moisture absorption.  When even slightly wet they are super uncomfortable.  Definitely don't plan to sweat in these.6. Pair of Thieves Cotton Boxer Briefs for Men Pack (4 Pack) - 4 Stars:  Not as comfortable as all of the non-cotton options, but a decent value.7. Smartwool Boxer Brief - 1 Star: Complete and utter garbage.  Overpriced, not very comfortable, not any better at wicking moisture away than all of the similar priced options.

reviewText: I recently bought the KIDMI Women's Suede Clogs Leather Mules Cork for my 12-year-old daughter, and she absolutely loves them! I was looking for a comfortable, stylish alternative to Birkenstocks, and these mules were the perfect find.The cork sole gives them that classic Birkenstock feel, with great arch support and cushioning for all-day comfort. My daughter wears them to school, on walks, and just lounging at home, and they never seem to hurt or cause discomfort—something I really appreciate. The suede upper gives them a more polished, versatile look, which works well with both casual outfits and a bit more dressed-up styles.What’s also great is how easy they are to slip on and off—perfect for a busy tween who’s always on the go. The fit is true to size, and they’ve held up really well even with regular use. Plus, the leather mules are lightweight but sturdy, so they don’t feel bulky like some other clogs.Overall, These are a great buy, and I'd recommend them if you're looking to save some money but still get a super stylish look with comfort.

reviewText: The Fruit of the Loom Men's Coolzone Boxer Briefs are great value for anyone seeking comfortable, breathable, and affordable underwear.The boxer shorts are made from soft, breathable cotton that feels good against the skin. Keeps you cool throughout the day. The waistband is elastic yet soft, staying in place without digging into the skin. The boxer briefs have a snug fit around the thighs but aren’t overly tight, ensuring comfort for extended wear. They don’t ride up during movement, which is a big plus.The XX-Large size fits true to size, providing a comfortable fit for those with larger builds. There’s enough stretch to ensure flexibility without feeling constrictive. The fabric holds up well after multiple washes without shrinking and the color doesn’t wash out easily.The black and gray color scheme is simple and versatile. It’s great for anyone who prefers neutral, classic tones in their undergarments. I wish they had an all-gray color scheme though.These boxer shorts are perfect for daily wear, whether lounging at home, working in an office, or running errands. They also perform well during light exercise, though they might not be as moisture-wicking as premium activewear.

reviewText: The pants arrived on time nicely packaged in plastic and a box. The size 48x32 was correct in both places, on the sticker as well as the sewn in tag denoting made in Mexico. I’m 5’10”, 270 lbs and coming down in weight and from a 50” waist  line. Hence, the 48x32. Having enough room in the thighs has always been an issue, but not with the Wrangler Rustler Classic Relaxed Fit. These fit true to size! 48” inches is comfortably perfect and the length was spot on! There was comfortable room throughout the thighs, crotch and seat! The quality of the denim is on par with my favorite Big & Tall store brand jeans without the $60+ price tag! The color of the dark rinse was even throughout, NO blotches or discoloration whatsoever. All the seams were straight, smooth and evenly sewn. I counted 9 belt loops vs 8 on my fav old jeans. If I had to nit pick, it would be the size of the pockets. The Rustler has slightly smaller pockets but not by more than 1/2-1 inch in most directions except for the depth of the back pockets, not a deal breaker, since I don’t prefer many items in pockets as a rule, but deduct 1 star. However, the exceptional price point of this high quality Wrangler Rustler Classic Relaxed Fit Jean restored my overall rating to 5 Stars! At this time it’s an excellent buy for myself as I endeavor to keep getting smaller. Will definitely be a go to jean for future consideration! And YES, they actually look great…definitely pleased!

reviewText: Buying clothes online can often be disappointing.  Not being able to see  and feel garments is always a roll of the dice.  Very happy to say this shirt was an absolute win.The shirt came in a tiny box. That threw me for a second, but I now applaud the Eco- packaging.  No pins,  no cardboard etc.  Shirt was cleanly sealed in a plastic bag with zero wrinkles.QUALITY: Very well made, with perfect even seams and stitching.  Nicely finished collar.  Tight buttons.MATERIAl:  Soft stretchy polyester and spandex blend. Almost feels like cotton.  Great feature for outdoors: UPF 30.  Besides being nearly wrinkle free,  another nice plus is wicking shirts dry fast.  I travel a lot and sometimes run out of clothes.  Being able to hand wash a few items and have them dry quickly (and still look presentable) is always appreciated.  Especially when packing light for long international travel.FIT  Because it's stretchy- ideal as active wear, and not just golf.  Happy to report the shirt was true to size.  Something that's always a challenge with many other imported shirts.LOOK:  Firm collar, and flattering fit.  M MAELREG  has their logo tastefully ironed on the sleeve.  I chose the Grey, which was more of an off-white.  It has multi grey and pink stripes.  Other reviews stated some other colors were a bit too neon.  Luckily, the stripes on the grey are subtle and keeps the shirt understated. .FEEL:  I'm a fan of breathing-wicking shirts.  Especially in the hot humid South during summer.  Polo shirts are the  equivalent of a Woman's little black dress.  Casual, but the collar still keeps them dressy enough for just about anything. This shirt can easily be dressed up worn under a sport coat.  Another essential for travel.Negatives:  None to speak of.  Usual slight finishing odor.  I wash everything before wearing so no complaints.  I would of liked more of a choice of primary solid colors or variations.All in all, very nice shirt and good comparative value to similar polo shirts.  Very pleased.

reviewText: I always thought these types of shoes looked a little goofy. It was mostly my disdain for leather shoes seeing as I live in the desert and that the maintenance on these was wild to me.I'm not a man that takes great care of his footwear, nor am I one to be a shoefile. To me, footwear is to be used and abused.Having said that, as a dad, lately I've been finding it hard to look put together in my footwear, I wear mostly boots, and black runners to keep life simple. But these are darn cozy shoes. Warm in the evening, confidence inspiring during social events, even the wife complimented my increased dad appeal. Buying these on a cyber Monday whim to keep my gym shoes to the gym and family walks, boots to the outdoors and other Western dresses, and these to have on those casual but look good type of days.I'm really impressed with the overall comfort, the weight is inbetween light and heavy, but they don't fatigue my feet, leaving plenty of the room, I like that they stay on and don't slip off the heel being high tops, harder to get on fully laced but I'm still very much function over form in the fashion department so I don't intend to wear them as the younger more hip crowd tends to.The design is timeless, and quality seems well built, so I expect these to go out of style before I need another pair.On a sale, they were a great value and I'm very excited to try something kind of new for me.Plus side is the fact that the white is almost nuclear. In the dead of night these things practically light the path for me.

They are loose but lightweight under t shirts. The temperature reached 82 degrees today, and I was wearing one of these under cotton shirt, thick jeans as well and I wasn't sweating or uncomfortable at ALL. I'm used to sweating easily.I have not experienced hives since wearing these to regulate my body temp.I ordered a size small. For reference I have 27 waist and 36 inch bust. The small perfect.
