reviewText: Took me three tries to get this jacket but thanks to Amazon's easy return policy I finally got it and there's a lot to love about it.  First, I ordered a Large because that's what I wear.  The sleeves are really long to the point there was no way I could keep that size so I exchanged for a Med.  The Med. arrived a couple days later and the zipper was broken.  Not just hard to get on and off as I expected that, but the zipper was literally bent to the point where I had to take the jacket off over my head and pry the zipper enough to finally get it open.  So, returned it, replacement arrived a few days later and it was right as rain.Sleeves are still a tad long but I'm fine with that and there is enough space in the jacket for a sweater underneath for layering.  The washed fabric feels much more broken in than the standard Carhartt which I really appreciate.  While rated a 2 in warmness on their bizarre rating scale, this jacket is extremely warm.  It has been around 30 degrees in my area lately and I get toasty in this thing.  The pockets are great,  The interior left chest zipper packet and right side chest velcro pocket were must haves for me and are a welcome addition.  Also, I ordered the attachable hood here on Amazon for $25.00 bucks.  One of my wants was a jacket that didn't have an attached hood and this is one of the few that Carhartt offers.  It is odd to me that for 25 bucks more they don't just include it with the jacket but whatever.  Zipper is somewhat stiff as others have mentioned but once you find the sweet spot of getting it on, you get the hang of it and it becomes second nature.All in all I really like this jacket and hope that it lasts me a very long time.  4/5 stars simply because I don't just throw out 5 stars unless something really blows me away.  This is technically a 4.5 because it's exactly what I was looking for.  Highly recommended.

reviewText: Okay, so I needed some new workout shirts, and these Real Essentials ones seemed like a pretty good deal. Five shirts for that price?  I figured it was worth a shot.The Good: * Fit: I ordered my usual size and they fit well. Not too tight, not too baggy.  Just a nice athletic fit. * Comfort: The material is surprisingly soft and comfortable. It's lightweight and breathable, perfect for working out. * Performance:  They definitely wick away sweat. I wore one to the gym the other day and it kept me dry throughout my workout.  No more soaking wet cotton shirts! * Value:  You really can't beat the price for five shirts. It's a great value, especially if you're on a budget.The Not-So-Good: * Durability:  They seem a little thin. I'm a bit worried they might not hold up well after multiple washes. Only time will tell. * Color Selection: The colors were a bit basic. Would be nice to have some more vibrant options.Overall:For the price, these Real Essentials active t-shirts are a solid buy. They're comfortable, perform well, and you get a good amount for your money.  If you're looking for some affordable workout shirts, I'd say go for it.  Just don't expect them to be the most durable shirts you've ever owned.

reviewText: I live on the Oregon coast, which is not known for it's sub-zero temperatures, but it can get below freezing from time to time ... And the wind can be pretty nuts.  I ordered this because I didn't really have a coat for winter weather.  Well, this definitely fits the bill.  While I can't comment on arctic temperatures, I can say it is NOT for a mildly cool day.  It snowed here recently, and I was snug as a bug in this.  It's super comfortable and soft.  I haven't had any issues with the fuzz getting caught in the zipper like I've seen in other reviews.  I'm 5'7 and about 200 lbs (look, I'm working on it), and the Large fits me perfectly.  I'm really happy with this coat.  It's a great bang for your buck.

reviewText: THIS IS UNBELIEVEABLE! I normally do not give an opinion on a product the very same day it arrives, as I like to use/wear it awhile first, before I decide if I like the product  or not. However, I was so overjoyed with what Amazon delivered today, that I could not wait.  I am a short person, 5'0 short, who has searched my entire adult life for jeans that fit properly. One year, many years ago, before school started, we, as we had done for years, went to the only store (a small family owned store) that carried the uniforms required by the parochial schools in our metro area. As the sales/ fitting lady helped our 3 daughters, I asked her if I could try on some jeans.  She was kept busy, helping my girls fit  their uniforms and mark them at the right places, where the seamstress would take them in. I wasn't aware that everytime I came out of the dressing room and looked into the 3 way mirror, that she was watching me. When I had tried on every jean they had out for sale, as was usual, ALL of them were way too long by than 6 inches or more. Running into a dead end, so to speak, as I usually did with jeans, I put them back where I had found them and hung them up. I returned to see how my daughters fittings were going. She looked like she had something to say, but was hesitating. When she spoke she said, I don't mean to be a busybody, but I noticed that the jeans we have for sale were all way too long for you. May I make a suggestion for you to try? I told her she should tell me what she wanted to say. She informed me that the size jean I needed in a junior sizing, would ALL be way too long, unless I was lucky enough (at the time) to find someone who carried Petites. I asked off hand, if she knew of anyone who carried them at the time. She told me no, but that she thought I would get a perfect fit, and here she inserted,I hope I don't offend you by saying this, but I think a girls size 14 would be perfect for you. She pointed the way. Having nothing to lose, I tried her suggestion. It was as though I had found custom fitted jeans! I chose a few pair, and from then on, I always went to the girls department when I needed any sort of pant.  This past year, my jeans looked like they had seen their day. As I wanted to try some in the beautiful colors they now make, I looked at 2 of the better known, name brand jeans that were out there. I found almost NOTHING, in the size I needed, but even if it wasn't a color I would normally have chosen, I purchased the few I found offered and in stock, who claimed to fit according to the chart, between a 2 Petite and a 4 Petite. When they came, many were still way too long and the rest that were that was the right length, then the hips and waist were way too big. But beggars can't be choosers so they say, and I kept the ones that fit best lengthwise. The more I thought about it, after washing and wearing the 6 or so pair I had kept, I had kept, I recalled seeing  a picture of Amazons jeans for petite women, on one of the pages where I had ordered the jeans I now had. I decided to give them a try. I purchased 2 pair, as that would give me more jeans than I needed, but a little bit of summery color. They came today.  These are THE BEST jeans, fit wise, fabric wise and color wise, I have ever owned in my 64 years. I am NOT joking when I say that, for the first time ever, I was elated! I now have 2 pair of jeans that look and fit as though custom made. I only wish I hadn't washed and worn the name brand jeans that are ill fitting. The quality really surprised me, as the fabric was soft, supple and the jeans are very well constructed. Length is perfect. And, they are perfectly fitted to my hips and waist, not needing a belt. The next time I need or decide to buy jeans again, I am going straight to Amazon's page and place my order. And so many color choices for me! For the very first time, I have a choice of EVERY color they make, in all the larger sizes of the name brand jeans, but rarely, if ever in my size or length. I am in heaven! For a woman my age who has put up with either a poor color choice because the store does not buy large quantities of the 2 smallest sizes, and they go fast IF they carry them at all, or having to choose jeans that are too big in the hips and/or waist, I now have two VERY well made, VERY lovely looking pairs of jeans, that no one would ever know they aren't one of the name brands. Thank you Amazon!  I have waited my entire life, to find pretty colored, well fitting, well made jeans that up until now, I had to compromise on something, to wear. These jeans are perfect! A perfect fit. Perfect colors and sturdy construction. I will forget about those name brand jeans, (and their price) and head straight to Amazons jeans page. I KNOW I won't be disappointed. You made my year!

reviewText: I took the nudge from other reviewers and sized down and I'm thrilled with the fit of these jeans.Currently I normally buy and fit well in a size 12 jean. I ordered these LEE women's ultra LUX comfort flex jeans in a size 10 and the fit is like a glove and comfortable.They are (for jeans) VERY stretchy but don't seem like grandma jeans.The color is deep and rich. I haven't washed them yet but will probably wash them with black or other jeans and only in cold water. I doubt they'll shrink due to the cotton/poly content though possibly slightly in length which is sufficient (I'm 5' 5)My only complaint so far is that the front pockets are SHALLOW. That's so annoying because basically they're not functional pockets unless you carry a tissue or a quarter in them. Give me some real pockets here please.Now back to the fit.I'm hour or pear shaped and have thick thighs and a smaller waist.These are a beautiful fit for someone like myself who has thighs and a smaller waistThe waistband is super stretchy; it's different than any jeans waistband I've had and I'm not complaining about it. It does not look like an elastic waist and comes up above my belly button hugging all my curves nicely.If you have thin thighs these will probably fit  looser in the thigh area. I wouldn't mind that but that's not how I'm built.I Like the flair leg bottomThese will definitely stretch as you wear them which , for me, is another reason I'm glad I sized down to the 10. I don't like having my pants falling down so that I have to shimmy them up all day. I think these will stay put as well as give me a freedom to move.The price tag at 27 ish dollars is great too. I'm very happy with them so far and once I wear them for a bit will probably get another pair.Will update if needed but for now I recommend these jeans.They fit like a glove and feel good on while hugging my curves give me freedom to move.

reviewText: Army green. I really like the look of these pants with the front pleats and adjustable waist.  I’d say the most common compliment with these is, “You look dapper!“. I imagine there would eventually be some fabric piling. I wanted to provide close-up pictures of the texture and color, which does have relatively few loose fibers compared to other Paul Jones tweeds, and is a most single hue of dark forest green with black herringbone.  In other words, this is a NOT a multicolor herringbone. I wanted to make a full suit out of it, as I am obsessed with forest green suits currently. However, it appears that all of the blazers which are sold as army green are multicolor. They also have a slightly wider width to the herringbone pattern. The final picture shows them next to each other, with the pants being a much darker green compared to the blazers, which have a lot more golden yellow fibers in them. The texture is also different, with the blazers, having somehow a slightly smoother feel despite having more loose fibers on the surface, while the pants have a slightly more burlap feel to them. It would be nice to offer pants  that match a blazer for a full suit look for those who want one.

reviewText: I recently got the M MAELREG Men's Golf Shirts, and they have quickly become my go-to choice for both golf and casual wear. Here’s why I highly recommend them:Comfort: The dry fit, moisture-wicking material is incredibly comfortable. It keeps me cool and dry, even on the hottest days. The fabric is soft against the skin and has a nice stretch, allowing for freedom of movement during my swing.Performance: These shirts are designed with performance in mind. The moisture-wicking technology works like a charm, keeping me comfortable and focused on my game. The short sleeves and breathable fabric make them perfect for long hours on the course.Fit: The regular fit is just right—not too tight and not too loose. It provides a flattering silhouette while allowing for easy movement. The collared design adds a touch of sophistication, making these shirts suitable for both golf and casual outings.Style: The striped design is classic and stylish. The variety of colors available makes it easy to find a shirt that matches my personal style. Whether I’m on the golf course or out for a casual day, these shirts look great and receive plenty of compliments.Quality: The quality of these shirts is top-notch. The stitching is solid, and the fabric holds up well after multiple washes. They haven’t faded or lost their shape, which is a big plus for me.Value: For the price, these golf shirts offer excellent value. You get high-quality, stylish, and performance-driven shirts that are perfect for various occasions. It’s a great deal for anyone looking to upgrade their wardrobe with versatile and reliable polo shirts.

reviewText: I bought this dress for a casual picnic style wedding. I knew I wanted a bold summer color, something lightweight so I wouldn't be sweating all afternoon. Most importantly, I wanted a dress to highlight my recent 40 pound weight loss, and my  regained self confidence.I am 5 ft, now 152 lbs. As its been a very long time since I've been this weight, I was very unsure what size to order. And since I wear a 36DDD/F bra, that makes it even more difficult to find clothes that fit right.First I ordered a XL, which was much too large everywhere. But I knew this was the dress I wanted! I exchanged it for a Large, but it was still slightly too big, so I sent it back for a Medium, which thankfully was perfect!I have never minded showing off the girls and this dress allows just a touch of sexiness without being inappropriate. (NOTE- I did have to order a plunge style  bra so the center wouldn't show in the small opening beneath the knot).The Rose Red color is beautiful, and must be the It color this summer! I actually saw many women wearing almost identical colors, or similar pinks!It was 80°, no shade at all where the ceremony was held,  and the lightweight material kept me comfortable the whole time. It has a 2nd thin layer underneath, similar to a built in slip. It helps ensure comfort, but also helps prevents panty lines.The flowing sleeves give it a fun and flirty touch, making the dress very versatile.  It can be worn for Ladies night, date night. I paired it with bright pink lace up sandals, and matching earrings, or the dress alone could be the focal point, worn with nude shoes, and simple jewelry.After struggling with my weight for years, this is the first time I've been able to dress up and feel good about myself. Being able to fit into a size Medium after wearing a 2XL for this long, and finding this gorgeous dress that looks so flattering, made me feel so confident.My only recommendation; I don't ever really iron, (I think I've probably ironed 2x in the last 8 years lol), but it couldn't have hurt. The dress arrived about 3 or 4 days before the wedding and I had it hanging in my closet until the day of. I definitely won't say that it wrinkles easily. It lasted the whole wedding without a single crease appearing. But I could have run a warm iron over it to get the wrinkles out from shipping, and I'll have to see how it looks after I wash and line dry it. I suspect it may require a quick iron to smooth it out. But well worth it for such a beautiful dress.Great quality for a great price. Sheer perfection. This is THE summer dress for any occasion!Do not hesitate to buy this. You won't regret it!

reviewText: These are my favorite shoes & these are my second pair. Only reason I replaced the first pair is cus I wore them down being lazy and shoving my feet into them without untying them. I never write reviews but these shoes are worth the time to review lol

reviewText: These are great quality and very comfortable. I got XL and XXL for my son and his Dad. One is about 160-180lbs, got XL and it was a perfect fit.  The other is between 180-200lbs, got XXL, again perfect fit. Neither one likes their underwear overly tight, but to still form to the body and not slide down. Both fit comfortable, were soft, good quality, durable material. Seemed breathable, with medium thickness (not those thin ones that wear holes for their privates to fall through. Lol) and seem to have good stretch. Didn't look like they shrunk in the wash. I'll keep getting these! Picky 13yr old approved!

reviewText: Amazing shoes.Got them for an upcoming marathon and it's just awesome. Great cushion, not too soft/hard, just right. Keeps my legs and knees feel better after running long distance. It's built for warmer temperatures but it's still good even in during winter since our feet gets warm during runs. Really durable, especially the soles, but take note that these are pavement/road shoes so not that much traction for dirt/offroad, but it's still good regardless. Definitely worth it for the price, especially for the discounted price since the 27 is out. A bit longer, I got a 10.5 wide and the length feels like it was an 11. Support is good, which is rare for someone with high arch. Color is amazing, doesn't look too dirty when it's dirty. Buy this guys, or the 27s. I'm definitely buying the 27s as well. Asics is just awesome!

reviewText: I knew, then researched to be sure, that Rustlers are made by Wranglers.  I wear Wranglers normally and decided to try the more affordable ( not to say cheaper ) brand. reviewText: For many years, I have purchased standard shrink to fit 501 Levi's and needed a couple new pair of 36W x 34L pants.  These appear to be very similar to what I have purchased many times.  First, I was sure to purchase the New Rigid color.  These are the heaviest and most basic without any additional washing or processing.  They are also the best price (approximately $50).  I have not seen any difference in the thickness or weight of the fabric.  These are rigid and take time to become soft and flexible, which is what they will be after wearing them for awhile and having several washings.  There are a lot of stickers on the product, which I have attached.While the Amazon listing indicates these are made in Mexico, the sewn0on label indicates the country of origin is Indonesia.  The reality may be that various parts of the product are likely made in various countries, including where the cotton is grown, where the raw cotton is made into fabric, where the fabric is processed,  where the thread is made, where the buttons are made, where the product is sewn, and finally where the product is inspected.  This is just modern day manufacturing.  Only time will tell if I get the same wear life on these as I have on others I have owned.I notice that on the Levi's website, they indicate a shrink allowance of 1 on the waist and 3 on the length for this size, but the label on these indicates 2 on both the waist and the length.  So, we will see which is correct.  In the past, I have always followed the 1 - 3 specification for this size.
